ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
AASPIRE Participant Type / Version Administered
Notes: 1= Direct Report (DR); 2= Direct Report - Supported (DR-S); 3= Caregiver Report (CR)

ElementDescription: Thinking about the past month, how often did the following barrier get in the way of (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) communication? Barrier: The environment was too noisy, or overstimulating for (me/them) to communicate successfully.
Notes: 1= None of the Time; 2= Some of the Time; 3= About Half the Time; 4= Most of the Time; 5= All the Time

ElementDescription: Think about the times when this barrier has happened in the past month. In general, how big of a barrier (Direct Report: was it to your / Caregiver Report: do you think it was to their) communication? Barrier: The environment was too noisy, or overstimulating for (me/them) to communicate successfully.
Notes: 1= It did not get in the way; 2= It got in the way a little bit; 3= It moderately got in the way; 4= It got in the way a lot; 5= It totally got in the way

ElementDescription: Thinking about the past month, how often did the following barrier get in the way of (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) communication? Barrier: People did not give (me/them) enough time to communicate successfully.

Barrier: People did not respect (my/their) need to communicate in a certain mode. For example, by reading, writing, texting, or emailing, or by using sign language, a picture board, a letterboard, gestures, or body language.

ElementDescription: Thinking about the past month, how often did the following barrier get in the way of (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) communication? Barrier: (My emotions/I think their emotions) made it hard to communicate successfully. For example, fear, anxiety, stress, embarrassment, frustration, anger, exhaustion, or how other people made (me/them) feel.

ElementDescription: Think about the times when this barrier has happened in the past month. ElementDescription: Thinking about the past month, how often did the following barrier get in the way of (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) communication? Barrier: (I/they) could not communicate successfully because (I/they) have not yet found a way to communicate fluently enough. For example, (I was/they were) unable to communicate successfully because (I/they) could only use single words, short phrases, or scripts, or (I only was/they only were) given limited answers to pick from.
Notes: 1= None of the Time; 2= Some of the Time; 3= About Half the Time; 4= Most of the Time; 5= All the Time

ElementDescription: Think about the times when this barrier has happened in the past month. In general, how big of a barrier (Direct Report: was it to your / Caregiver Report: do you think it was to their) communication? Notes: 1= It did not get in the way; 2= It got in the way a little bit; 3= It moderately got in the way; 4= It got in the way a lot; 5= It totally got in the way

ElementDescription: Barriers to Communication Scale - Overall, in the last six months, did the things this survey asked about...
Notes: 1 = Get worse; 2 = Stay about the same; 3 = Get better

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) Did you get any help while answering the questions in this section of the survey?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I did not get any help
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me use a computer, smartphone, or other device (for example, they clicked on the answers I chose).
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone read the survey to me.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me understand what the questions or answers options meant.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me decide how to answer the questions on the survey.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I got some other type of help to answer the questions.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone answered the questions for me, without my input.
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): They told me (in whatever mode they communicate)
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I have observed the action, behavior, or event
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I can interpret their behaviors and/or vocalizations
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Someone else told me
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I have known them for a long time
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I spend a lot of time with them
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): None of the above
Notes: 0= No/Unchecked; 1= Yes/Checked

ElementDescription: (Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other, specify
(Caregiver Report) On a scale of 0 to 10, how confident are you about your responses?
Notes: 0= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Score of Frequency of Barriers to Communication Questions
Notes: Higher scores indicate more frequent experience of barriers to communication. Sum of (barcom_noisy, barcom_time, barcom_vocab, barcom_recognition, barcom_interrupted, barcom_supporter, barcom_tech, barcom_privacy, barcom_body, barcom_vague, barcom_misunderstand, barcom_assuming, barcom_mode, barcom_emotions, barcom_fluent)

ElementDescription: Score of Severity of Barriers to Communication Questions
Notes: Higher scores indicate greater severity of barriers to communication. Sum of (barcom_noisy, barcom_time, barcom_vocab, barcom_recognition, barcom_interrupted, barcom_supporter, barcom_tech, barcom_privacy, barcom_body, barcom_vague, barcom_misunderstand, barcom_assuming, barcom_mode, barcom_emotions, barcom_fluent)

ElementDescription: Sum of Products of Frequency and Severity of Barriers to Communication
Notes: Sum of the products of each item frequency score and severity score, e.g., barcom_noisy * barcom_noisy_big. 0 if Frequency score missing; equal to the frequency score if frequency is greater than 1 and severity is missing
